questions.question: What is the primary purpose of Double Sideband Amplitude Modulation (DSB-AM)?

answers.a: To transmit information by varying the amplitude of a carrier wave
answers.b: To transmit information by varying the frequency of a carrier wave
answers.c: To transmit information by varying the phase of a carrier wave
answers.d: To transmit information without any modulation

explanations.a: Correct! DSB-AM varies the amplitude of a carrier wave to transmit information.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Modulation is essential for transmitting information.

questions.question: In DSB-AM, what are the two sidebands that are produced?

explanations.a: Correct! DSB-AM produces both USB and LSB.
explanations.b: Incorrect. The carrier is not a sideband.
explanations.c: Incorrect. The carrier is not a sideband.
explanations.d: Incorrect. The carrier is not a sideband.

questions.question: What is the modulation factor in amplitude modulation?

answers.a: The ratio of the peak amplitude of the modulating signal to the amplitude of the carrier signal
answers.b: The frequency of the carrier signal
answers.c: The total power of the modulated signal
answers.d: The bandwidth of the modulated signal

explanations.a: Correct! The modulation factor is defined as the ratio of the peak amplitude of the modulating signal to the amplitude of the carrier signal.
explanations.b: Incorrect. The frequency of the carrier signal is not the modulation factor.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Total power is not related to the modulation factor.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Bandwidth is not the modulation factor.

questions.question: Which of the following is a key advantage of Single Sideband Amplitude Modulation (SSB-AM) over DSB-AM?

explanations.a: Correct! SSB-AM uses less bandwidth compared to DSB-AM.
explanations.b: Incorrect. SSB-AM is generally more complex to implement.
explanations.c: Incorrect. SSB-AM transmits only one sideband.

questions.question: What happens if the modulation factor exceeds 1 in amplitude modulation?

answers.b: The signal is transmitted without any issues

explanations.a: Correct! A modulation factor greater than 1 leads to distortion in the signal.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Exceeding the modulation factor leads to issues.
explanations.c: Incorrect. The carrier signal is not lost but distorted.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Bandwidth does not necessarily increase with distortion.
